forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly cloudy, with a low around 50. West wind around 6 mph.

forecast.name: Saturday
forecast.detailedForecast: Partly sunny, with a high near 60. West wind 6 to 12 mph.

weather_report:
As dawn breaks over Downtown San Francisco, the atmosphere is shrouded in a soft blanket of clouds, lending an ethereal quality to the waking city. The overnight chill, teetering around a comfortable fifty degrees, lingers—an invitation for a light jacket or cardigan to ward off the early morning coolness. A gentle west wind whispers through the avenues, bringing a hint of moisture from the ocean, yet not enough to obscure the iconic skyline illuminated in the pale light of dawn.

The day ahead promises to shake off the afternoon haze, giving way to scattered sunbeams that will emerge from behind the clouds. With temperatures forecast to nudge up toward the sixties, the air will feel pleasantly crisp, making it a fine opportunity for a leisurely stroll along the waterfront or perhaps a visit to the various coffee shops nestled in the heart of the city. While fog may hover over the bay, its presence will be more of a gentle caress than a heavy cloak, allowing glimpses of the signature landmarks without fully enveloping them. Thus, dressing in layers will be key—comfortably warm for the morning's bite but prepared for the inviting embrace of midday sunshine. Embrace this tranquil yet vibrant day, perfect for savoring all the simple pleasures San Francisco offers.
